title: Energy Efficiency Technology Centre | Singapore Institute of Technology
text_lines: Community Leadership And Social Innovation Centre
Centre for Infrastructure and Tunnel Engineering
Rapid Product Innovation and Development Centre
Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee
The Gift that Keeps on Giving
Community Leadership And Social Innovation Centre
Centre for Infrastructure and Tunnel Engineering
Rapid Product Innovation and Development Centre
Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee
The Gift that Keeps on Giving

In collaboration with the National Environment Agency (NEA), the Energy Efficiency Technology Centre (EETC) aims to be the leading technology innovation centre that supports local Small & Medium Enterprises (SMEs) in energy efficiency initiatives.
EETC aspires to promote the development of energy efficiency capability and the adoption of new technologies in the local energy ecosystem for the industrial sectors.
EETC supports local industries in energy efficiency initiatives and helps to address both short and long-term needs in the local EE ecosystem through the following:
Catalyse EE improvements at SMEs through the provision of energy consultancy services.
Develop a pipeline of engineering undergraduates in industrial energy efficiency.
Upskill existing engineers or EE practitioners through practical hands-on training courses.
We help SMEs be more competitive by reducing energy costs through low-cost high- quality energy assessments.
We provide energy consultancy services and actively collaborate with our industry partners to co-create innovative solutions to overcome current industry challenges.
We offer the Energy Efficiency Upskilling Programme (EEUP) that provides practical, hands-on training to complement classroom-based knowledge for engineering professionals.
EETC provides low-cost, high-quality energy assessments to SMEs. The energy assessment of industrial facilities owned by SMEs will be led by EETC energy specialists.
Motor Driven Systems, Audit and Analysis
This course covers energy conservation opportunities for motor-driven equipment, including MDS design, system evaluation, and energy management programmes.

Explore elements that contribute to sustainable and resilient data centres, focusing on innovative technologies and strategies that ensure business continuity and minimise downtime during disruptions.

Learn about smart grids and their integration with key technologies. Smart grids revolutionise electricity generation, distribution, and consumption by utilising real-time data, advanced analytics, and intelligent automation.
Energy Sustainability and Energy Management Systems
Explore effective energy management and sustainability practices to reduce operating costs, comply with regulatory requirements, and address global energy sustainability and environmental challenges.
Electric Vehicles and Charging Infrastructure for Decarbonisation of Land Transportation
Learn about sustainable transportation systems and technologies, while delving into electric vehicles and their associated infrastructure.
Compressed Air System Audit and Analysis
In this 5-day course, energy managers, engineers and facility managers will learn about energy-efficient operations and monitoring techniques for compressed air systems.
Energy Efficiency and Process Optimisation for Process Industries
This 5-day course is designed to enable energy managers and plant facility engineers in the process and petrochemical industries to identify energy-saving opportunities within their plants.
In this 5-day course, acquire the knowledge to leverage current and emerging technologies to design energy-efficient systems.
Learn HVAC operations, measurement, data acquisition, and analytics to determine SEC of chilled water and air handling systems.
Pump and Piping Network: Energy Efficient Design, Audit and Analysis
This intensive course is for energy professionals with pre-requisite knowledge and experience, seeking to upskill in pump and piping systems.
Lighting Systems Energy Efficient Design: Audit and Analysis
Learn to identify energy conservation opportunities, evaluate lighting systems, conduct energy audits, design and select energy-efficient equipment, and propose budget plans.
The members of the Industry Advisory Committee for this programme are:
Director, Sustainability Division National Environment Agency
Director, Urban Systems Solutions Enterprise Singapore
Acting Director, Futures of Building & Infrastructure Division JTC Corporation
Chief Sustainability Officer, Assistant Chief Executive Singapore Manufacturing Federation
Vice President, Association of Small and Medium Enterprise
Vice President, Resource & Carbon Economic Development Board
Director, Industry Development Division 1 SkillsFuture SG
Deputy Executive Director, Industry Development Singapore Precision Engineering Technology Association
Executive Director, Singapore Chemical Industry Council
Giving SMEs a leg up: Energy Efficiency Technology Centre

The centre offers low-cost third-party assessment services for applications for NEA’s recently enhanced Energy Efficiency Fund, acting as a support pillar for SMEs keen on optimising their energy efficiency measures.
Strong Start to Boost SMEs’ Energy Efficiency and Upskilling

The Energy Efficiency Technology Centre (EETC) upskilled 200 professionals and conducted 120 audits to help Small and Medium-sized Enterprises (SMEs) optimise their energy usage in its first phase of operation.
Professor Lock Kai Sang: Solving Real-world Problems

The head of the Energy Efficiency Technology Centre (EETC) at SIT applies a unique blend of research excellence and real-world experience to advancing engineering education while addressing key challenges like decarbonisation and energy efficiency.
Advocating for Excellence in Engineering Education

Prof Lock received an accolade from the World Federation of Engineering Organizations (WFEO) – the 2021 Co-Laureate of the WFEO Medal for Excellence in Engineering Education. He shares what the award means to him, his passion for teaching and his philosophy on the future of engineering education.
The applied research at SIT brings our rich industry experience and technical skills into our work, creating a better physical environment for learning and innovation.
We work with teaching programmes and innovation projects to improve the skills of our students and strengthen and energise our industry and the wider community.
We welcome individuals passionate about the Energy Sector to embark on a transformative career with SIT today.
“The professionalism and dedication demonstrated were evident throughout the entire process, and we highly recommend EETC for energy assessment service.”

“EETC’s thorough assessment of our machinery, categorized by type and location, helped us understand our energy consumption more precisely. This has enabled us to move forward with a more detailed and actionable energy management plan.”

“EETC’s assessment of our electrical system provided valuable insights into how power quality can influence energy consumption and equipment longevity. With their guidance, we now have a comprehensive understanding of our electricity capacity, power quality, and the safety and efficiency of our system.”
To learn more about our service offerings, please email us.
Follow our latest updates on social media!
Singapore Institute of Technology. All Rights Reserved.
article_texts:
Energy Efficiency Technology Centre
In collaboration with the National Environment Agency (NEA), the Energy Efficiency Technology Centre (EETC) aims to be the leading technology innovation centre that supports local Small & Medium Enterprises (SMEs) in energy efficiency initiatives.
EETC aspires to promote the development of energy efficiency capability and the adoption of new technologies in the local energy ecosystem for the industrial sectors.
Value to Industry
EETC supports local industries in energy efficiency initiatives and helps to address both short and long-term needs in the local EE ecosystem through the following:
Catalyse EE improvements at SMEs through the provision of energy consultancy services.
Develop a pipeline of engineering undergraduates in industrial energy efficiency.
Upskill existing engineers or EE practitioners through practical hands-on training courses.
What We Do
Catalyse Energy Efficiency Initiatives
We help SMEs be more competitive by reducing energy costs through low-cost high- quality energy assessments.
Co-create Innovative Solutions with Industry
We provide energy consultancy services and actively collaborate with our industry partners to co-create innovative solutions to overcome current industry challenges.
Build Capability and Expertise
We offer the Energy Efficiency Upskilling Programme (EEUP) that provides practical, hands-on training to complement classroom-based knowledge for engineering professionals.
Energy Assessment for SMEs
EETC provides low-cost, high-quality energy assessments to SMEs. The energy assessment of industrial facilities owned by SMEs will be led by EETC energy specialists.
Read More
Energy Efficiency Upskilling Courses
Motor Driven Systems, Audit and Analysis
This course covers energy conservation opportunities for motor-driven equipment, including MDS design, system evaluation, and energy management programmes.

Explore elements that contribute to sustainable and resilient data centres, focusing on innovative technologies and strategies that ensure business continuity and minimise downtime during disruptions.

Learn about smart grids and their integration with key technologies. Smart grids revolutionise electricity generation, distribution, and consumption by utilising real-time data, advanced analytics, and intelligent automation.

Energy Sustainability and Energy Management Systems
Explore effective energy management and sustainability practices to reduce operating costs, comply with regulatory requirements, and address global energy sustainability and environmental challenges.

Electric Vehicles and Charging Infrastructure for Decarbonisation of Land Transportation
Learn about sustainable transportation systems and technologies, while delving into electric vehicles and their associated infrastructure.

Compressed Air System Audit and Analysis
In this 5-day course, energy managers, engineers and facility managers will learn about energy-efficient operations and monitoring techniques for compressed air systems.
Sign up
Energy Efficiency and Process Optimisation for Process Industries
This 5-day course is designed to enable energy managers and plant facility engineers in the process and petrochemical industries to identify energy-saving opportunities within their plants.
Sign up
Electrical Installations Audit and Analysis
In this 5-day course, acquire the knowledge to leverage current and emerging technologies to design energy-efficient systems.
Sign up
HVAC Audit and Analysis
Learn HVAC operations, measurement, data acquisition, and analytics to determine SEC of chilled water and air handling systems.
Sign up
Pump and Piping Network: Energy Efficient Design, Audit and Analysis
This intensive course is for energy professionals with pre-requisite knowledge and experience, seeking to upskill in pump and piping systems.
Sign up
Lighting Systems Energy Efficient Design: Audit and Analysis
Learn to identify energy conservation opportunities, evaluate lighting systems, conduct energy audits, design and select energy-efficient equipment, and propose budget plans.
